verses.kjv: The burden of the word of the LORD in the land of Hadrach, and Damascus shall be the rest thereof: when the eyes of man, as of all the tribes of Israel, shall be toward the LORD.
verses.web: A revelation. LORD’s word is against the land of Hadrach, and will rest upon Damascus; for the eye of man and of all the tribes of Israel is toward LORD;
verses.ct: A revelation: The word of the LORD is against the land of Hadrach and will settle on Damascus — for the eyes of all people, along with all the tribes of Israel, are turned toward the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Hamath also shall border thereby; Tyrus, and Zidon, though it be very wise.
verses.web: and Hamath, also, which borders on it; Tyre and Sidon, because they are very wise.
verses.ct: His judgment also falls on Hamath, which borders Damascus, and on Tyre and Sidon, despite all their cleverness.

verses.kjv: And Tyrus did build herself a strong hold, and heaped up silver as the dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.
verses.web: Tyre built herself a stronghold, and heaped up silver like the dust, and fine gold like the mire of the streets.
verses.ct: Tyre built herself a fortress and piled up silver like dust and fine gold like mud in the streets.

verses.kjv: Behold, the LORD will cast her out, and he will smite her power in the sea; and she shall be devoured with fire.
verses.web: Behold, the Lord will dispossess her, and he will strike her power in the sea; and she will be devoured with fire.
verses.ct: But look — the Lord will strip her of everything. He will shatter her power at sea, and fire will consume her.

verses.kjv: Ashkelon shall see it, and fear; Gaza also shall see it, and be very sorrowful, and Ekron; for her expectation shall be ashamed; and the king shall perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
verses.web: Ashkelon will see it, and fear; Gaza also, and will writhe in agony; as will Ekron, for her expectation will be disappointed; and the king will perish from Gaza, and Ashkelon will not be inhabited.
verses.ct: Ashkelon will see it and tremble with fear. Gaza will writhe in agony, and so will Ekron, because everything they hoped for will come to nothing. Gaza's king will be destroyed, Ashkelon will be left empty,

verses.kjv: And a bastard shall dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
verses.web: Foreigners will dwell in Ashdod, and I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.
verses.ct: and foreigners will occupy Ashdod. "I will crush the pride of the Philistines," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth: but he that remaineth, even he, shall be for our God, and he shall be as a governor in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.
verses.web: I will take away his blood out of his mouth, and his abominations from between his teeth; and he also will be a remnant for our God; and he will be as a chieftain in Judah, and Ekron as a Jebusite.
verses.ct: "I will snatch the blood from their mouths and their disgusting practices from between their teeth. But those who survive will belong to our God. They will become like leaders in Judah, and Ekron will be absorbed like the Jebusites were."

verses.kjv: And I will encamp about mine house because of the army, because of him that passeth by, and because of him that returneth: and no oppressor shall pass through them any more: for now have I seen with mine eyes.
verses.web: I will encamp around my house against the army, that no one pass through or return; and no oppressor will pass through them any more: for now I have seen with my eyes.
verses.ct: "I will stand guard around my house against any army that marches by or returns. No oppressor will overrun my people again, because now I am watching over them with my own eyes."

verses.kjv: Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion; shout, O daughter of Jerusalem: behold, thy King cometh unto thee: he is just, and having salvation; lowly, and riding upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass.
verses.web: Rejoice greatly, daughter of Zion! Shout, daughter of Jerusalem! Behold, your King comes to you! He is righteous, and having salvation; lowly, and riding on a donkey, even on a colt, the foal of a donkey.
verses.ct: Celebrate with all your heart, daughter of Zion! Shout for joy, daughter of Jerusalem! Look — your King is coming to you! He is righteous and brings salvation, yet he is humble, riding on a donkey — on a young colt, the foal of a donkey.

verses.kjv: And I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem, and the battle bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak peace unto the heathen: and his dominion shall be from sea even to sea, and from the river even to the ends of the earth.
verses.web: I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim, and the horse from Jerusalem; and the battle bow will be cut off; and he will speak peace to the nations: and his dominion will be from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth.
verses.ct: "I will remove the war chariots from Ephraim and the warhorses from Jerusalem. The battle bow will be broken. He will announce peace to the nations, and his rule will stretch from sea to sea, from the River to the ends of the earth."

verses.kjv: As for thee also, by the blood of thy covenant I have sent forth thy prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.
verses.web: As for you also, because of the blood of your covenant, I have set free your prisoners from the pit in which is no water.
verses.ct: "As for you, because of the blood of your covenant with me, I have freed your prisoners from the waterless pit."

verses.kjv: Turn you to the strong hold, ye prisoners of hope: even to day do I declare that I will render double unto thee;
verses.web: Turn to the stronghold, you prisoners of hope! Even today I declare that I will restore double to you.
verses.ct: Return to your fortress, you prisoners who still have hope! Even today I declare that I will repay you double for what you've lost.

verses.kjv: When I have bent Judah for me, filled the bow with Ephraim, and raised up thy sons, O Zion, against thy sons, O Greece, and made thee as the sword of a mighty man.
verses.web: For indeed I bend Judah as a bow for me. I have filled the bow with Ephraim; and I will stir up your sons, Zion, against your sons, Greece, and will make you like the sword of a mighty man.
verses.ct: I will bend Judah like my bow and load Ephraim as my arrow. I will rally your sons, Zion, against your sons, Greece, and wield you like a warrior's sword.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall be seen over them, and his arrow shall go forth as the lightning: and the LORD God shall blow the trumpet, and shall go with whirlwinds of the south.
verses.web: LORD will be seen over them; and his arrow will go flash like lightning; and the Lord LORD will blow the trumpet, and will go with whirlwinds of the south.
verses.ct: Then the LORD will appear above his people, and his arrow will flash out like lightning. The Lord GOD will sound the trumpet and charge forward in the whirlwinds of the south.

verses.kjv: The LORD of hosts shall defend them; and they shall devour, and subdue with sling stones; and they shall drink, and make a noise as through wine; and they shall be filled like bowls, and as the corners of the altar.
verses.web: LORD of Armies will defend them; and they will destroy and overcome with sling stones; and they will drink, and roar as through wine; and they will be filled like bowls, like the corners of the altar.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts will shield them. They will destroy their enemies and overwhelm them with sling stones. They will roar like men drunk on wine, overflowing like the sacrificial bowls, drenched like the corners of the altar.

verses.kjv: And the LORD their God shall save them in that day as the flock of his people: for they shall be as the stones of a crown, lifted up as an ensign upon his land.
verses.web: LORD their God will save them in that day as the flock of his people; for they are like the jewels of a crown, lifted on high over his land.
verses.ct: On that day the LORD their God will rescue them — his people, his own flock. They will sparkle across his land like jewels set in a crown, lifted high for all to see.

verses.kjv: For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! corn shall make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.
verses.web: For how great is his goodness, and how great is his beauty! Grain will make the young men flourish, and new wine the virgins.
verses.ct: How wonderful his goodness will be! How stunning his beauty! Grain will make the young men thrive, and new wine will refresh the young women.
